Zero Issue

Zero Issue

Have you ever wanted to be a super hero? Well, look no further than Zero Issue. This is a fun game that allows users to transform themselves into superheros. Our team created this beautiful, easy-to-use app, which gave users the ability to take a picture with their mobile phone, and then add fun visual props such as capes, masks, and light sabers. They could then upload their photos to their desktop and create a comic strip to share with their friends and show their transformation.

Our cross-class team consisting of myself and another back-end developer, two front-end engineers, and a mobile engineer, worked to create this app for our TIY hack-a-thon. We were required to build our product within 48 hours and present our final app to our stakeholders and classmates. Working against the clock, our skills were put to the test. I was able to leverage my business analysis experience to help our team define and understand the problem that we were trying to solve before a line of code was written. We then mapped out our MVP, and set up our tasks and timelines. At the end of the weekend, it was great to see folks using the app and having fun.
